definition: to give preferential treatment/to give special attention

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
small/tiny/few/young
kitchen stove/kitchen
variant of 灶[zao4]

sentences.english: The teacher promised to give these students special tuition.
sentences.chinese: 老师答应给这几个学生“开小灶”。

definition: to be given special treatment/to be treated in a favored way
mess hall for high-ranking cadres/(fig.) special treatment/cf. 大灶[da4 zao4]
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
to have an extra meal/snack
to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
to get food at a canteen
to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
to start providing food/to open today's service in a canteen
to show off one's abilities/to exhibit one's skills
to serve (food)
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to put some food aside for sb/to invite sb to stay for a meal/invitation to dinner
to teach class/to lecture
not shaken by thunder (idiom); the arrangements are unalterable/to adhere rigidly to regulations/will go ahead whatever happens (of an arrangement or plan)
topic of a lecture
